reviewText: Nice videos to watch.  These are a lot of videos to watch so sit back and relax. I think you will enjoy them all.

The bluray discs for First Class and  Wolverine didn't work. This was very frustrating for my wife and I- though it might have been our bluray player, we're pretty sure it was the discs. We would have returned them had we not used the digital discs and the other 3 of the collection hadn't worked either (which thank God they did).
It's all the current X-Men movies on Blu-Ray. It's cheaper than buying each on separately but the draw back is no digital copy.
This collection was great for me tying the different X-Men stories together, and making them complete. I love sci-fi, and action movies, and the collection satisfied both for me completely.

Surpasses anything a fan of the original comic series could ever imagine.  Great writing, excellent casting, stayed as true to the original as possible.  Second greatest comic book movie only to the Avengers!
The bluerays are  crystal clear with amazing sound. They were packed nicely and came on time. It's nice to do business with pros.

Note: I have two Blue-ray/ DVD players. One is "Region A or 1" (the norm in the US) and the other is "Region Free" so that I can play anything I want in it (including Region A's or 1's).  My Panasonic "Region Free" is only about a year old.

These Blue-ray disks has great a picture & sound.  How good the movie is I leave up to each person.  However, I do have a WARNING for everyone.

I just discovered that some of the "Region A or 1" Blue-ray disks that I bought on "Amazon" will not play in my "Region Free" player.  But they play just fine in "Region A or 1" player.

Most of the disks that will not play in my "Region Free" player will display a "Fox" back ground with a message that reads [This disc has been coded for Region A only and will not play in this machine. Please eject this disc and play on a Region A player.] on the screen after you insert the disk.  The others that will not play in "Region Free" player have different backgrounds with a similar massage.

*****Four of these five Blue-ray disks happen to have this problem!
  Only "X-Men Origins: Wolverine would play in both players.

Since I have one of each this is not a problem for me, but I thought it would be useful to know for those who might only have a "Region Free" player.

This is a bundle of five X-Men movies. Please note that this is not a box set, it is just the five movies sold together - each movie comes in its own separate blu-ray case. Video/audio quality varies by disc, but is generally excellent; these discs also include a variety of special features that take you behind the scenes of the making of the movies. The X-Men movies hold and important place in film history; the first film in the series is often credited as the film that launched the golden age of comic book superheroes on film. Both the original X-Men and it's sequel, X2: X-Men United, are well regarded among audiences. The final film in the trilogy, X-Men: The Last Stand, is not nearly as good as its predecessors - but it's still a fun movie with great action sequences. Also included in the bundle is the spin-off titled X-Men Origins: Wolverine, which looks at the early days of Logan (perhaps the most popular character in the franchise). And finally, X-Men: First Class is a prequel which examines the history between Professor Charles Xavier and his friend (turned adversary) Magneto. My own opinion is that the X-Men films are not quite on the level of Nolan's Batman trilogy or Sam Raimi's Spider-Man trilogy. However, these movies are very entertaining, and there are interesting themes related to society's acceptance/rejection of the mutants that parallel our own problems. In terms of technical achievement, I would single out the costume design and the makeup work as top-notch. If you've never seen the X-Men films, or if you're a fan but have yet to buy them, then this Complete Collection on blu-ray is the perfect set for you and comes highly recommended. Here are the links to the individual releases: X-Men [Blu-ray] X2: X-Men United [Blu-ray] X-Men - The Last Stand [Blu-ray] X-Men Origins: Wolverine (Two-Disc Ultimate Edition) [Blu-ray] X-Men: First Class (+ Digital Copy) [Blu-ray] (Amazon's prices constantly change, and in some cases it may actually be cheaper to buy the titles individually)
The only bad thing was that the X-Men: First Class disc wouldn't play in my blu-ray player; it gave me a message saying that the disc was for the wrong region.

As with other reviewers, everything was fine with these discs until I attempted to play X-Men First Class.  I then received the error stating that the disc was region "B" and it won't play on my region "A" Blu-Ray.  Although the product description says that the Region is "B/2"; the Editorial Reviews state "Please note this is a UK Import that is region free and is guaranteed to play on any US Blu Ray Player."  I give all the movies 5-Stars but my rating here is for the poorly written product description (I'm assuming they were done by the seller) and the hassle I now have in returning the product.  The funny thing is that I really only wanted X-Men First Class as I had all the other movies in DVD.  When I saw this Blu-ray package I thought, why not upgrade and see them all in better quality.
On the 3 XMen: the Last Stand the disk was marked on it not for rental.  Then when I tried to play it, there was a message that it would not play on Region A or B Blue Ray players.  What a rip!!
My Wife and I like X-Men movies and she wanted them for her birthday.  Great value!  Already watched the first 3!

Very VERY upset with this purchase, not one of these blu ray discs play!!!!  That's a couple hundred bucks just thrown away and a Christmas ruined.  I have 2 blu ray disc players and these dics will not play in either one

The Bluray will not play because of different region code. In response to G-Diddy...not everyone knows what bbfc stands for nor do they know to even look for that, hence we live in AMERICA. I have NEVER experienced this problem in the "x" amount of years I've been buying Blurays. Thank you for the undermining, patronizing comment you left. With all that said, I will now know to look for this symbol on my future Bluray purchases.

Bought this as an early Christmas gift for my pregnant girlfriend. She absolutely loves it! The Blu-Ray quality is incredible and adds 10x intensity to the action motion pictures! Great buy, and it was even delivered on Sunday!!!! WOW!
This is something you just have to see.  It is not for everyone, but it is for everyone with any sense!
decent quality other then the fact that it requires a diff blu ray player for X men First class other then that good product

I don't know why so many people are surprised it's a Euro version, when the symbol in the bottom left and right says it was rated 12 by the "bbfc" (The British Board of Film Classification) and the "IRISH FILM CLASSIFICATION OFFICE", respectively... I agree that the description should be updated, but I also think people should have looked at the fine print, in the picture, before purchasing...

So why did I give it a 3-star review, when I didn't even purchase it? Because I wanted to keep the reviews as neutral as possible...

Just as all the other reviews stated, the X-Men First Class is a region B blu ray and there is no advertsing about that fact on the description.  This is very bad adverstising and I'm surprised that Amazon is still selling it after these reviews.
first Class would Not Play In My Blu Ray Player Because It Was In A European Format. Why They Would Have Different Formats In The Same Set Is Beyond me.

I just bought the X-Men Trilogy boxed set, X-Men First Class, and X-Men Origins Wolverine on Blu Ray individually and it only cost $55.47.  You're paying $12 extra for this set, and it doesn't even come with a nice box for the main trilogy.
These movies are very very good. I got them a very good price. So much better in HD. I have watched them several times. I highly recommend buying this on Blu-ray you can't go wrong.

All the movies worked fine except First Class, that's the only one that is 'Region B' only, the rest are 'A/B' and work on standard american bluray players.  I suppose it's a good price for the collection without the final movie, but I decided to return it upon discovering this detail the seller left out.  Amazon didn't ask any other questions about it even though it was opened.

Outside of a tiny mention in the product specs, it was not mention in the title or long product description that this item would not play in a US player.  The return was easy though so everything is cool.  I think if you sell a non-region 1 DVD or blu- ray, you should put this info in the product title.

apparently the x-men 1st class disk doesn't play in newer blu ray players. So why buy this? go ahead and buy the X-men Quadrilogy and buy the first class blu ray separately!

***UPDATE, they made an adamantium edition X-men set that has even "The Wolverine" included. better to wait for that

i received the product and when i went and played the blue-ray's  one of the blue rays is for a special type of player a type B, my blue ray is brand new and it played all but 1 of the disk's ther should be a warning (x-men first class)
X-men first class does not work! It is the wrong region. all the other movies work but this one does not. avoid!

I really enjoyed all these movies and now by purchasing this set,I got the whole collection and in Blu-Ray too. YA-HOO! I'm building a library of movies I like & if their ones I really like,Blu-Ray is great. At this price,it was a bargain & the bonus is they are enhanced sound,Great for my surround sound. Practically there. Very pleased with my purchase. Definitely reccomend.
i purchased this as a gift and the recipient loved it!  I bought it as a deal of the day so it was a great price, too!
Love the Blueray disks for HD quality and clarity.  Could there be any more X-Men/Women in the near future?  Hope so.......

This 5 movie set is a big ripoff. None of them will play on my Blu-Ray player. I have the latest player updates and the bonus discs play fine but all 5 movie discs will not load or play. Don't waste your money or all you will get are expensive hand held mirror or glass coasters.
This a great bunch of videos for people who are X Men fans or people who just enjoy great fantasy and science fiction movies!
If you're a fan of X-Men this is a definite must in your collection.  A must buy, especially when it's on sale.

I purchased this set mostly to get the "Origins" and "FIrst Class" movies, as I already own the X-Men movies on DVD. I was pleasantly surprised that both of these titles were very well filmed with lots of action and great plots revealing the beginnings of the X-Men.  Now, having the other X movies on Blu Ray makes for another great movie watching experience when I decide to revisit those titles.

Got this set from goldbox at a much better price than it is currently selling at.  Be advised that this is not a box set, your getting the 5 movies just wrapped together, that said they were approx 6 dollars per movie on sale for some very good blu-ray movies.

Blu Ray is the only way to watch the series. The only let-down in the series is "First Class". If you view it as a "stand-alone" movie, it's entertaining, but the history on each character doesn't exactly tie in with the original three movies.

I upgraded from DVD to Blu Ray with the X Men movies because of the Amazon deal and I'm pretty happy with it. Yeah, X3 and Wolverine are pretty much throw aside (or give to friend) movies but the improved quality of picture and sound were well worth it.
Fun series.  A few problems with continuity from one movie to the next.  But just get over it and enjoy the story.
One of the cases we're busted

The good news is, this collection includes "all six" X-Men/Wolverine movies. The bad news is, there are now like nine or ten movies (depending on whether or not you count Deadpool) with ANOTHER two X-Men movies (New Mutants and Dark Phoenix) AND a second Deadpool already in production, and by the time you read this, there will probably be closer to 15 or 20. So, bit of advice, just wait until this franchise gets a "hard reboot" and then buy whatever super-boxset is out then.
it is the worst package that i ever bought. when i received it there are a few drill marks and damage on it.
added to wife's collection. She likes it

BE CAREFUL!  Make sure that you are buying Region 1 in the USA.  There was only one disk in this Collection that would not play.

Playback Region B/2  :This will not play on most Blu-ray players sold in North America, Central America, South America, Japan, North Korea, South Korea, Taiwan, Hong Kong and Southeast Asia. Learn more about Blu-ray region specifications

How is it that an order I placed in the USA can not be played in the USA. One of the discs says that this disc is coded for region B and your player is for region A therefore this disc can not be played.
i can't believe this! all the discs were REGION 1! First Class title is REGION 2! It doesn't work on my american blurry! shame on you amazon!
